wikipedia_page.main: Emma Little-Pengelly (born 31 December 1979) is a Democratic Unionist Party politician in Northern Ireland. She was the Member of Parliament (MP) for the Belfast South constituency in the House of Commons of the United Kingdom from 2017 until 2019, when she lost her seat to Claire Hanna of the SDLP. She previously served as an MLA for the Belfast South constituency in the Northern Ireland Assembly.
